function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of AI in disease diagnosis may lead to misdiagnosis or false positives, potentially causing harm to patients.","Impact":"Misdiagnosis can result in incorrect treatment, delayed intervention, or unnecessary stress for patients.","Mitigation":"Regular validation and verification of AI diagnosis by medical professionals, along with human oversight in critical decision-making.","Technologies":"Regular AI model updates, Explainable AI, and human-in-the-loop AI systems for decision-making.","People":"Patients, medical professionals, and healthcare organizations.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations and medical professionals."},{"Description":"Relying solely on AI for contagious disease screening may lead to overlooked cases or inaccurate results, contributing to the spread of the disease.","Impact":"Failure to accurately screen for contagious diseases can lead to increased transmission, outbreaks, and overwhelmed healthcare systems.","Mitigation":"Combining AI screening with traditional diagnostic methods, regular updates of AI algorithms based on new data, and rigorous testing and validation of AI results.","Technologies":"Combining AI with rapid diagnostic tests, real-time data monitoring, and contact tracing technologies.","People":"Public health agencies, healthcare workers, and the general public.","Owner":"Public health agencies and healthcare organizations."},{"Description":"AI in treatment may lead to over-reliance on automated systems, potentially overlooking critical patient factors and individualized treatment needs.","Impact":"Patients may receive standardized treatment without considering unique medical histories, personal preferences, or other relevant factors.","Mitigation":"Training healthcare professionals to interpret AI recommendations critically, integrating AI as a support tool rather than a sole decision-maker, and promoting patient-centered care with emphasis on individualized treatment plans.","Technologies":"Explainable AI models, personalized medicine platforms, and AI-augmented patient-doctor communication tools.","People":"Patients, healthcare professionals, and healthcare organizations.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations and medical professionals."}]}
